msIdentifier.msName: Johannes Bengedans' Book on Artillery and the Art of War

msContents.summary: Johannes Bengedans' Book on Artillery and the Art of War consists of two parts; one with rhymed texts and occasional illustrations (fols 1r-45v), and one mainly consisting of illustrations which in most cases have a short description (fols 46r-79v). These two parts seem to have been planned as separate works. There are a few traits supporting this hypothesis. These comprise a "second book" mentioned in the prologue, a second foliation on fols 46r-49r, and the fact that the text and illustration parts are not coordinated.

msItem.title: Johannes Bengedans' Book on Artillery and the Art of War
msItem.bibl: Blosen and Olsen, Krigskunst og Kanoner Facsimile-edition

msItem.author: Johannes Bengedans
msItem.title: Prologue
msItem.rubric:
Johannes bengedans van greuensten
in hessenlant / Der hot diz buch ghescriben
mit syner hant ∴
msItem.incipit:
IN deme namen gotis wil ich heben an
Eyn nige ghedichte ab ich kan
msItem.explicit:
So bistu seker vor wart vor allen dinghen
Wat dyr de busse kan scaden to bringhen

msItem.rubric: von Salpeter Capitel primum j
msItem.incipit:
Hir na scriue ik vnde ist dat best
Du salt lesen went an dat lest
msItem.explicit:
Ynde is keyn solt mer dar by
Dar van her nat adder fuchte sy

msItem.rubric: von deme Sweuele Capitel ij
msItem.incipit: Uon deme swebele sage ik dyr als ik wet
msItem.explicit: Vnde knachet her ynder dynen fingeren so ist her gut

msItem.rubric: van den kolen Dat iij Capitel
msItem.incipit:
UAn kolen ich dyr scriben wil
Wat se nutte sint to dusseme spil
msItem.explicit:
Der eme syne gherechte ghewichte geuet
Dey meister schop sere dar ane cleuet

msItem.rubric: woman salpeter seden sal. Dat iiij Capitel
msItem.incipit:
HIr nach wil ik dyk salpeter leren seden
Vnde dat salt dar vane scheyden
msItem.explicit: Der mot salpeters in disser kunst wille vor lesen

msItem.rubric:
Wyltu salpeter luteren
Dat .v. Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Wyltu luteren eynen cyntener
Salpeters mynner adder mer
msItem.explicit: Der salpeter mach danne wol bestan borwar

msItem.rubric: wo men sweuel reyinghen sal Dat vj Capitel
msItem.incipit: WIltu swebel reyningen ouer al.
msItem.explicit: Sa mach her denen to pilen vndefure gemeyne.

msItem.rubric: Wyltu gude kolen maken Dat vij Capitel
msItem.incipit:
WIltu kolen von kunst maken gut
So habe dusse wyse indiner hut
msItem.explicit:
Unde schadet keyn alder nicht
Des ich my dicke habe vorplicht

msItem.rubric: von den rechten ghewichten ¶ viij capitel
msItem.incipit:
Ich wil dy nu openbar maken kvnt
Ok van ghewichten wo vele lot hebbe eyn punt
msItem.explicit: So kanstu dyner kunst rechte walden

msItem.rubric: wo man merkurium sublemeren sal
msItem.incipit: Ok wil ek dy nu bescríuen openbar
msItem.explicit:
Unde mach dyr dan wal bestan
To allen kunsten dar du en wult to han

msItem.rubric:
woman eynen torne neder scheten sal
¶ x Capitel
msItem.incipit: HAlt dik an dit capitel wal myt sýnnen clar
msItem.explicit:
Unde kanst rechte bruken dusser kunst
So krigestu der heren unde forsten gunst

msItem.rubric: van gemeyne pulver ¶ xj Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Alsus wil ek dir nu maken kunt
Dat du vornemest to dusser stunt
msItem.explicit:
Dir puluer nemant schelden kan
Is dat solt von deme salpeter ghedan

msItem.rubric:
Von guden fur pilen
¶ xij Capitel
msItem.incipit:
NOch wil ek dyr vrobat maken kunt
Eyn cleyne capitel to dusser stunt
msItem.explicit: Der worde der van nicht swacke

msItem.rubric:
Efft du belegen bist myt eyme here
¶ xiij Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Nv wil ek dyr segen eyne list
Offt du myt eyme here belegen bist
msItem.explicit:
Unde kanst dan dar vp synnen
Dat du ere upsate konst breken vnde ghewynnen

msItem.rubric:
van puluer vppe den daken
¶ xiij Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Wyns puluers wil ek dy vnderwisen
Dar an saltu dich halden vnde prisen
msItem.explicit:
Unde vorbernnen alle dar
Eyns anderen nym hir na war.

msItem.rubric: Von guden pilen ¶ xv Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Svs wil ik dyr vorbat don kunt
Ik wil dek meisterliken leren to dusser stunt
msItem.explicit:
Unde sal sik silues vppe der stede entzunden dar
Des sik sin nabor nicht ervrowet twar

msItem.rubric:
Wo men eynen draken scheden sal
¶ xvj Capitel
msItem.incipit: BEware dek vnde wes vorsichtig to aller tijd
msItem.explicit:
Se springen beyde hin vnde her
Unde vorbernen dat her inde wide vnde inde twer

msItem.rubric:
woman de furkogelen scheten sal.
¶ xvij Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Ek wyl dy nu eyne kunst bewisen
Dar saltu dik ane halden vnde prisen
msItem.explicit:
Unde is eyn greselik vnde eyn grymlik gruelich fur
Wor et komet dar bernet it gar vngehur

msItem.rubric:
Van guden czunder
¶ xviij Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Nv wil ek dyr eyns czunders make wro
Dat saltu stede in dyme synne behalden also
msItem.explicit:
Dar ut wert dyr gar gud czunder
Dat dir dan denet to pilen vnde fure besunder

msItem.rubric:
Von slach pilen
¶ xix Capitel
msItem.incipit: GEdenke nu dat ek dy openbar hebbe bescreuen
msItem.explicit:
Unde salt dat czunder wol ansteken
Dat sal den pil entzunden vnde to breken

msItem.rubric:
So du belegen last myt eyme her
¶ xx Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Ek wyl dy nu leren eyne list
Dat du myt eyme here belegen bist
msItem.explicit:
Myt sulker vp sate kanstu dy erweren
Unde liff vnde leuen dar mede erneren

msItem.rubric:
Wo men hagel scheten sal
¶ xxj Capitel
msItem.incipit:
DAt is kunt vnde al openbar
Wo men hagel scheten sal des nym war
msItem.explicit:
So saltu se dan entzunden an
Unde scheten to deme wolke ane wan

msItem.rubric:
Von der worpstangen
¶ xvij Capitel
msItem.incipit: ALsus wil ek dy nu houeliken bewisen
msItem.explicit:
Dat saltu eyne sweuel sticken insteken
De sal de stangen entzunden vnde to breken

msItem.rubric:
Wo man eyne bicken scheten sal
¶ xxiii Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Nu wil ek dy van der bicken don kunt
Wo men de scheten sal to aller stunt
msItem.explicit:
Wen se in sulker flamme stad
Unde sulk eyn fur begrepen had

msItem.rubric:
Wo men eyn grekes fur scheten sal
¶ xxiiij
Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Svs wil ek dyr vor bat bewisen
Beware dik vnde an vorsichticheyt saltu dy prisen
msItem.explicit:
Also men den pilen sal don
Dat hebbe an merke vnde an son

msItem.rubric:
Wo men by nacht scheten sal
¶ xxv Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Uan eyner vpsate wil ek dyr don kunt
De saltu in dyme synne merken to aller stund
msItem.explicit:
myt sulker list kanstu se betwyngen
Dat se sik van deme slote geuen vnde díngen

msItem.rubric:
Wy man eyn fur dorch eyne katzen vnde eyn
tribende werk schissen sal
msItem.incipit:
AN disse kunst halt dich myt list
Ob du uff eyme slosse belegen bist
msItem.explicit:
So kanstu ere uff satze wrechen
Unde katzen vnde tribende werke czubrechen

msItem.rubric: Ayn Olio czu macken van Czigel capitels xxvij
msItem.incipit:
NV wil ich dir sagen vorwar
Uan eyme oleige al offenbar
msItem.explicit:
Dy dar sint van siner art
Unde dar mete vormenget uff der fart

msItem.rubric:
Wy man ghemeíne puluer machen sal
.C. xxviij
msItem.incipit:
GEdenke vnde nym des ebene war
Uan ghemeynen puluer al offenbar
msItem.explicit:
Unde kanst dar methe wal bestan
Wor daz puluer wirt henne ghethon

msItem.rubric:
Wyman eyn besser puluer machen sal
.C. xxix
msItem.incipit:
RIsscher puler wil ich dyr machen kunt
Van delunge bessir ist czu aller stunt
msItem.explicit:
Daz puluer ist czu grosßzin steynen gut
Vnde salt daz stete haben jndiner hut

msItem.rubric:
Wyman by eyner nacht eyne halbe
last puluers machen sal
¶ xxx Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Eyne vor borgen kunst ich dyr sage
Dor noch setze alle dinen sin vnde nicht eyn clage
msItem.explicit:
Vnde kanst alle steyne darmete schisßen
Der ladunghe losße dich nicht verdrisßen

msItem.rubric:
Van guthin philen die indem wassir
vß bernnen.
¶ xxxj Capitel
msItem.incipit:
Van pilen wil ich dyr nu bescryben
Vnde vaz man dar mete kan betriben
msItem.explicit:
Dornoch setze alle dyne synne
So hostu eynen phil vnghewynne

msItem.rubric:
Wy du eynen schosß vor lengen salt
myt eyme puluer
¶ xxxij capitel
msItem.incipit:
EIne kunst wil ich dyr machen clar
Wy du schisßen salt al offenbar
msItem.explicit:
So kanstu den schoß ober wynnen
Vnde czu brenghen myt sulichen synnen

msItem.rubric:
Wyman puluer scheiden sal
¶ xxxiij capitel
msItem.incipit:
Nym puluer daz alt vnde vorlegen ist
Du sal an dyr haben disse list
msItem.explicit:
Vnde bestet in allen dinghen
Also kanstu Alt vorlegen puluer betwingen

msItem.rubric:
Wy du eyne bussen laden salt
¶ xxxiiij
msItem.incipit:
Sich vnde merke myt synnen
Wy du eyne bussen laden salt van bynnen
msItem.explicit:
Dye sint beschosß adder nicht
So wes hyr methe bericht

msItem.rubric:
Wy wil puluers kegen eynen
steyn horen sal
¶ xxx v capitel
msItem.incipit:
Vo Von allen dinghen saltu haben moße vnde gewicht
An moße vnde teilunge alle din kunst licht
msItem.explicit:
Vnde dar czu dinen quadrant
Rechte mosße ist dir dan czu ghewant

msItem.rubric:
Wyman hart knollenpuluer
machen sal
¶ xxxvj.capitel
msItem.incipit:
Eyn hart knollenpuluer do ich dyr kunt
Wy du daz machen salt czu disser stunt
msItem.explicit:
Daz puluer saltu werffin adder schisßen
Des trugens loß dich nicht verdisßen

msItem.rubric:
Wyman eynn stark puluer machen sal
¶ xxxvij capitel
msItem.incipit:
NV wil ich dyr bescriben czu aller czijt
Daz du von sorgen werdest quit
msItem.explicit:
So ist daz puluer van sulicher art
Alle bereit uffe der fart

msItem.rubric:
Wyman eynen phil der nacht
machen sal.
¶xxxviij capitel
msItem.incipit:
Ich wil dir nu bescriben vnde beweren
Van eyme phile dar saltu nicht van keren
msItem.explicit:
Vnde weme her wirt czu gaste ghesant
Her muchte willen daz her jn ny hette ghekant

msItem.rubric:
Von steynen die czu kleyne hauwen sint
wyman die laden sal
¶ xxxix capitel
msItem.incipit:
Noch saltu wissen vnde merken
Daz du worsichtich sin salt in allen werken
msItem.explicit:
Vnde sullen nicht vor den steyn gan
So mogen die bissen wal bestan

msItem.rubric:
Ab die busse besser schisße van eyner
lege puluer dan van czuen
¶ xl capitel
msItem.incipit:
Hostu vor nomen vnde vor standen wal.
Waz ich dyr habe bescreben ober all.
msItem.explicit:
Vnde wert wil witer gehschosßen
Des saltu nicht sin ver drosßen

msItem.rubric:
Eyn fur daz man in eyn schiff
werffin mach
¶ xvj capitel
msItem.incipit:
Eyn fur wil ich dyr nicht vor helen
Dar methe du dine figende salt quelen
msItem.explicit:
Vnde werfin czu en uffe der stunt
Dan vorsenken sy bis uffe dy grunt

p.watermark: There are five different watermarks, all of them can be traced back to Piemont (Northern Italy), Savoy and Switzerland. The watermarks can be dated to between 1438 and 1485.

foliation.p: Foliated in red ink in the upper corner of the recto pages, probably by Kristian Kålund with the exception of fol. 33a; most possibly a mistake. On fols 46-49 an old foliation, starting with 1, can be found. This might be an indicator, that the part with illustrations originally was intended to be an individual book.

collation.p: There are seven quires, but due to the tight binding and added leaves the original collation cannot be identified with certainty.

condition.p: A water damage on the upper part of the book block and near the spine has made the text difficult to read or even illegible. The comments to the illustrations have been particularly damaged and at some places the text can only be desciphered using a specific light; at other places the text is lost entirely. As this water damage has only affected the book block and not the binding it must have happened before the codex was bound. On some leaves, especially in the last quire, the edges were excised.

layout.p: The text is written in long lines throughout with 27 to 33 lines per page. The rubrics and initials are red, and the first letter of each line is decorated with a simple red stroke. Only the initial on fol. 1v is red and blue with foliage and extends to the top margin and along the text block. Usually, chapter numbers are found in the outer margins next to the first lines of the chapter.

handNote.p:
The scribe, Johannes Bengedans of Grebenstein, Hessen, names himself on the first page of the manuscript (1r): Johannes bengedans van greuensten
in hessen lant / Der hot diß buch ghescriben
mit syner hant ⁂.

The handwriting of the book, including rubrics, chapter headings and descriptions of the illustrations, is similar to the writing in three letters, signed by Bengedans. He is also mentioned as a participant in the negotiations in 1447/48 when the Deutscher Orden wanted to buy the island of Gotland.
The rubric on fol. 33a was possibly writen by a second, not much younger hand.

decoNote.p: The illustrations, made by Bengedans himself, can be roughly divided into two categories: weapons or tools, and "actions" in a broad sense (e.g. fol. 77r how to walk underwater). The text part of the book (fols 1r-45v) only features occasional drawings in the margins or at the end of a chapter and these are usually done in orange and/or brown ink. Often the illustrations are equipped with short descriptions or explanations written in red ink. Only on fol 24r a full-page illustration is found.

The illustration part of the book (fols 46r-79v), however, contains large colourful drawings, mostly taking up the whole page, these are only provided with rather short descriptions in normal ink.
Fol. 46r castle with fortress, Wyman eyn bolewerk vorsteden edder
vor sloten buwen vnde vorwaren sal.
myt stortinngen vnde myt graben.
Fol. 46v a sort of a battering ram, Eyn tribende werk dar mete man
eyne muren brechen mach.
Fol. 47r tent (with fortress in the background), man geczelde beslan
sal unde wy man dye myt
fußangelen bewaren sal.
Fol. 47v castle and man-traps, Wy man eynne borch vnde
eyn bolewerk myt fuß
angelen vnde myt jnstor
jnstortzingen myt graben
vnde de bedacht myt
geryngen borden vnde de horde
myt wrasen bedacht vnde
bewassen lasßen
bewaren mach.
Fol. 48r shield (mantlet) and scaling ladder, Wye man eyne leteren
an eyne muren brengen sal.
Fol. 48v shield, Wye man eyn …
slande ghescher
machen sal.
Fol. 49r bolt and launching poppet for crossbows, Wy man fur myt eyme
boltzen schisßen sael Wy man eynen bock czu
armborsten machen sal.
vnde dar mete czu spannen.
Fol. 49v cart, Wy man eyn uffslande
bolewerk vnde tribende
werk machen sal.
Fol. 50r canon with machine for lifting it, Wy man eyne bussen uff
eynen wagen geringe
scruben sal.
Fol. 50v battering ram, Eyn tribende werk dar mete
man eyne muren brechen mach.
Fol. 51r cart, Wyman uff slande tribende werk
vorbuwen vnde machen sael.
Fol. 51v rotating frame for guns, Eyn vnnelouffende schyben myt klinken vnde slosßen
dar ses bussen jn gefelliget synt jn eyme gestelle
vnde schusßet eyne nach der anderen recht fur
sich vß als dye vir bussen nach eyn ander nigefellet sint.
Fol. 52r frame for guns, Eyn ander gestelle dar sint wir bussen
jngefelligit vnde sullen gelich eynander
ligen jn eyner stellunge.
Fol. 52v frame for guns, Wy du achte eft nun bussen jn eyne
stellunge brengen sal daz dye myt
klinken wael dorch fasßet ist vnde
daz man dye klinken dorch fassen sal.
Fol. 53r a winchlass, Wye sich eyn selbes uff wynden sal. vnde
daz eyn man czweyn uffe eyn murenbrengen sal.
vnde merke dye ander mosße myt deme krige
vnde daz her rechte gesnort werde czu dissen
beyden wynden als hir vmme stet.
Fol. 53v winchlass, Wy sich eyn selbes uff wynden sal. vnde eyne muren bestigen vnde gewynnen mach.
Fol. 54r battering ram, Wy man eyne spisßen dorch gen
vnde gewynne mach so habe ditz
tribende werk in hoet vnde in acht.
Fol. 54v frame for gujns, Wy man eyne stellunge
czu eyner bussen mache
vnde beslan sael.
Fol. 55r cart/mantlet, Eyn tribende geschirm dar vßman louffen
vnde stormen mach vnde wyman daz
buwen sael.
Fol. 55v catapult, Wy man eyne bliden
buwen vnde stellen sal.
vnde dar mede werpen.
Fol. 56r cart/mantlet, Wy man eyn uff slanden tribende
gheschirm buwen vnde machen sal.
Fol. 56v scaling ladder, Wyman eyn tribende
werk myt eyner
leiteren an eyne muren
brengen sal vnde datz
verbuwen.
Fol. 57r tongs/scaling ladder, Wy man eyne czangen
machen sal dar meteman
eyne leteren an eyn muren
brengen magk.
Fol. 57v wall hooks, Wye man eyne muren
bewerffen sael.
Fol. 58r cart/shield, Wyman eyne tribende
catzen machen sal.
Fol. 58v scaling ladder, Wy man eyne leteren machen sal
dar mete man eynne muren
ghewynnen vnde bestigen mach.
Fol. 59r chariot, Eyn tribende werk daßma an eyne
muren brengen mach vnde dar
vß men stormen mach.
Fol. 59v chariot/mantlet, Wye man eyn tribende ghschirm
vor steden edder slosßen machen sael.
Fol. 60r scaling ladder, Wy man eyne leiteren machen
sal vnde an eyne muren brengen
mach vnde eyn muren bestigen.
Fol. 60v trebuchet, Wy man eyne vmmeloffende bliden swengel.
ver buwen vnde machen sal dar metman
steyne vnde fur werffen mach.
Fol. 61r catapult, Wy man bliden buwen sal.
vnde dar mete werffen sael.
Fol. 61v scaling ladder, Wy man eyne .eiter.. van
remen czu houffe spannen sal
dar men eyne muren
bestigen mach.
Fol. 62r shield, conceiling men carrying spears.
Fol. 62v shield, conceiling men carrying spears.
Fol. 63r machine/battering ram, Wye man eyne spisßen
czu brechen sal mye tribende werken
vnde wyman dye buwen sal.
Fol. 63v machine/battering ram, Eyn ander tribende werk wy man daz
buwen sal vnde eyne spisßen dar mete
ghewynnen vnde czu brechen sal vnde
de spisßen dar mede schicken sal.
Fol. 64r scaling ladder, Wy man leiteren machen
sael dar mete man
muren bestigen mach.
Fol. 64v scaling ladder, Wye man eyne garne
leiteren machen sal.
Fol. 65r battering ram, Wy man eyn tribende werk an
eyne muren brengen sal vnde de
brechen mach.
Fol. 65v shield, Wy man schirm tarßen machen sal .
Fol. 66r machine/battering ram, Wo man eyn tribende werk machen
vnde buwen sal vnde eyne spisßen
darmede dorch gen sal (with instructions for colouring the drawing: gel).
Fol. 66v machine/frame for guns, Wy man eyn driuende werk
to stride machen sal.
vnde myt strit bussen
daz gewynnen sal.
Fol. 67r machine/battering ram, Wy man eyn tribende werk machen sal.
dar mete man eyne muren brechen
mach vnde dye erstigen sal..
Fol. 67v catapult, Wye man eyn fur myt eyner bliden
slengern werpen sal vnde wye man
die bliden machen sal.
Fol. 68r cart/mantlet, Dytz sint czwey tribenden geschirme
dar wur man stormen mach
Fol. 68v cart/battering ram, Wy man eyn tribende werk machen
sal. dar vs man stormen mach.
Fol. 69r cart/mantlet, Eyn triben gehschirm
dar man vor schisßen
vnde stormen mach.
Fol. 69v cart/mantlet, Wye man eyn tribende geschyrme machen
sal dar vor man schißen vnde stormen mach .
Fol. 70r man with shield and pickaxe in front of a castle, Wy man eyn slosß vnder
hauwen vnde graben.
mach daz man es gewynne.
Fol. 70v two horses (one rider), pulling a cart, Wye man eyne wagen
borch beslan sal vnde
waz czu eyme wagen
hort vnde dar uff sin sal.
Fol. 71r wooden corbels with notes written on them, Wy man eyn ober
hangen hus myt knen
buwen sal. (with notes in the drawing: secndus
2 and primus
1).
Fol. 71v parts of a corbelled house (with notes around the drawings: eyn tappe eyn kny eyn tappe; eyn bant and eyn bant).
Fol. 72r parts of a corbelled house, Wy man die kne bande
be hauwen sael., and Wy man de wende
czu beyden siten des
hus vorbynden sael.
Fol. 72v crane with a winch, Wy man eyne
wynden sal anrichten
dar mete man eyne
swere last mach uff
richten vnde wynden.
Fol. 73r a machine on wheels and a mantlet, Wy man eyn scherme czu
bussen machen sael demen
nicht uff czeyen czehen sael
also man myt der bussen
schesßen wel.
Fol. 73v battering ram, Wy man eyn
tribende werck
machen sal.
dar mete men
eyne spisßen
brechen mach.
Fol. 74r battering ram, Wy men eyne spitzsßen
brechen vnde gewynnen
mach.
Fol. 74v fencing shield, Eyn hauwende vnde
stechende schilt czu fechten .
Fol. 75r buckler shield, Eyn pokler.
Fol. 75v machine/cart for firebombing, Eyne tribende . Wye man fure beslan vnde
bewynden vnde beczehen sael.
Fol. 76r pole for firebombing, Wye man fur werffen sael.
Fol. 76v machine for water?, Wye man wasser leiten sael.
Fol. 77r diver, Wye man vnder deme wasser gen sal.
Fol. 77v device for conquering and crossing a moat, Wo man eynen wasser graben ghewynnen
vnde myt geretschoff ober gen sal.
Fol. 78r winch.
Fol. 78v hook?
Fol. 79r detail of hook or winch?
Fol. 79v windlass.

additions.p: Several marginalia occur, the marignalia on fols 3v-4v, 18r-v, 24v and 44v are written in another hand.

binding.p: Grey cardboard binding, probably from the time around 1770-80. 300 213 21

origin.p: The manuscript was written by Johannes Bengedans in Hesse, Germany. The watermarks of the paper and the three existing letters written by Johannes Bredegans indicate that the manuscript was probably written between 1440 and 1451.

custEvent.p: Exhibited at Moesgård Museum Aarhus Denmark from 9 October 2006 to 28 January 2007 in connection with the facsimily-edition.

listBibl.bibl: Black and white prints AM 374 fol. 7 August 2003
